gui

Class BasicRobotTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.BasicRobotTest

  • public class BasicRobotTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    chasejones Tests the BasicRobot.java class and its various methods for functionality. Tests features like its movements and rotations, energy consumption, odometer, etc.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BasicRobotTest() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void canSeeExit()
      Tests that a robot at the exit can actually see the exit.
      void isActuallyAtExit()
      Tests the .isAtExit method.
      void isNotAtExit()
      A robot should never spawn next to the exit, so this test makes sure the isAtExit() method actually returns false when the robot is at the start.
      void resetRobot()
      Resets the robot to the starting position of the maze, and refills its battery back to full.
      void robotInRoom()
      Tests the .isInsideRoom method.
      void robotNotInRoom()
      Tests the .isInsideRoom method.
      void rotateChangesEnergy()
      Tests that a robot's battery level is actually changed after a rotate operation.
      void rotateWithoutEnoughEnergy()
      Tests that a robot without enough energy to rotate that tries to rotate does not successfully do so.
      void setUp()
      Runs before each test, creating a new app and maze.
      void testCannotSeeExit()
      Tests that a robot cannot see the exit.
      void testEnergy()
      Tests that the robot starts with 3000 energy.
      void testHasDistanceSensor()
      Tests that a generic basicRobot has a distance sensor.
      void testMoveOneStepForward()
      Tests that moving the robot, testing its .move function, actually changes its position.
      void testMoveOneStepForwardManual()
      Tests that moving the robot manually, testing its .move function, actually changes its position.
      void testOdometer()
      Tests to make sure the robot starts with odometer at 0, and after one move the odometer is 1.
      void testRotateAround()
      Tests the robot's rotate around functionality.
      void testRotateLeft()
      Tests the robot's rotate left functionality.
      void testRotateRight()
      Tests the robot's rotate right functionality.
      void testTranslateDirection()
      Tests the translateDir() method, which takes the robot's current direction and maps it to a cardinal direction.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • BasicRobotTest

        public BasicRobotTest()

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
        Runs before each test, creating a new app and maze. Get the BasicRobot from the controller so it can be tested on. Skill level 2 and imperfect maze is order for room checking testing.

      • resetRobot

        public void resetRobot()
        Resets the robot to the starting position of the maze, and refills its battery back to full.

      • testOdometer

        public void testOdometer()
        Tests to make sure the robot starts with odometer at 0, and after one move the odometer is 1.

      • testEnergy

        public void testEnergy()
        Tests that the robot starts with 3000 energy.

      • testRotateRight

        public void testRotateRight()
        Tests the robot's rotate right functionality. Should change its direction to clockwise from the original one.

      • testRotateLeft

        public void testRotateLeft()
        Tests the robot's rotate left functionality. Should change its direction to counter clockwise from the original one.

      • testRotateAround

        public void testRotateAround()
        Tests the robot's rotate around functionality. Should change its direction to opposite the original one.

      • rotateChangesEnergy

        public void rotateChangesEnergy()
        Tests that a robot's battery level is actually changed after a rotate operation.

      • rotateWithoutEnoughEnergy

        public void rotateWithoutEnoughEnergy()
        Tests that a robot without enough energy to rotate that tries to rotate does not successfully do so.

      • testMoveOneStepForward

        public void testMoveOneStepForward()
        Tests that moving the robot, testing its .move function, actually changes its position.

      • testMoveOneStepForwardManual

        public void testMoveOneStepForwardManual()
        Tests that moving the robot manually, testing its .move function, actually changes its position.

      • isActuallyAtExit

        public void isActuallyAtExit()
        Tests the .isAtExit method. Gets the maze's exit from the maze's Distances, sets the robot's position to there, then tests the method.

      • isNotAtExit

        public void isNotAtExit()
        A robot should never spawn next to the exit, so this test makes sure the isAtExit() method actually returns false when the robot is at the start.

      • canSeeExit

        public void canSeeExit()
        Tests that a robot at the exit can actually see the exit. Gets the maze's exit from the Distances computed and then sets the robot's location to there.

      • robotInRoom

        public void robotInRoom()
        Tests the .isInsideRoom method. Searches the maze until it finds a position inside a room, then sets the robot's position to there and checks if the robot is in a room using its own method.

      • robotNotInRoom

        public void robotNotInRoom()
        Tests the .isInsideRoom method. Searches the maze until it finds a position not inside a room, then sets the robot's position to there and checks if the robot is not in a room using its own method.

      • testHasDistanceSensor

        public void testHasDistanceSensor()
        Tests that a generic basicRobot has a distance sensor.

      • testCannotSeeExit

        public void testCannotSeeExit()
        Tests that a robot cannot see the exit. Since this is tested when the robot is at the start of the maze, it should never be positioned next to the exit, making the test work.

      • testTranslateDirection

        public void testTranslateDirection()
        Tests the translateDir() method, which takes the robot's current direction and maps it to a cardinal direction.
